Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1190776: MPlayer command line start video at x position
ul_393478: Start playing a video at a certain time
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_393478: #!/bin/bash
[ "$1" = "-q" ] && shift && quiet=true || quiet=false
hms=(${1//:/ })
printf -v now '%(%s)T' -1
printf -v tzoff '%(%z)T\n' $now
tzoff=$((0${tzoff:0:1}(3600*${tzoff:1:2}+60*${tzoff:3:2})))
slp=$(((86400+(now-now%86400)+10#$hms*3600+10#${hms[1]}*60+${hms[2]}-tzoff-now)%86400))
$quiet || printf 'Alarm goes off at %(%c)T.' $((now+slp))
sleep $slp
mplayer /path/to/video.mp4

Explanations about Options.-ss:
Seek to given time position. Use -ss nopts to disable seeking, -ss 0 has different
 behaviour.
